I agree. So for starters...

Random number shuffling upon minting is great and fine for projects that do not have team allocations. 

But when you go to give an allocation in a direct order there is a human that knows the order of the nfts. This is able to be reshuffled and adapted to give a desired outcome.

In order to prevent this there should be a way to allow the canister to generate a random nft upon pressing the mint button. That way there is no pre determined outcome within the order of the nfts. 

The obstacle that comes with this is that the team would have to use funds to mint their nfts or set a tiered wl event where the team sets the mint price to be a minimal cost and then carry on with the next wl tiers at the desired price. 

Overall it is too late to do this for this collection but for future collections it would be a great feature to have native to the marketplace launchpad.

referenced_message.content:
We're not bridging to another place. We're not creating a new collection to go trade on an unfamiliar marketplace. We're not taking Motokos to OpenSea or MagicEden.

We're building a new home for NFTs on ICP in Bioniq. This Motoko collection will trade natively on Bioniq (on ICP). You could argue we're not even bridging them at all because Motoko Sentinels will trade directly on ICP (on Bioniq).

So this is completely different. 

We're even going to integrate ICP NFTs directly into Bioniq as well (we're like 80% done with this already) at which point Bioniq is a nice cross-chain marketplace. And then you can trade Motoko Ghosts/Mechs on the ICP side of Bioniq and you can trade Motoko Sentinels on the BTC side of Bioniq.

We've also already launched multiple collections on Bioniq, and have more in the pipeline, so this isn't a one-off collection. This is part of a cohesive strategy to help ICP grow by integrating with Bitcoin.

referenced_message.content:
Bioniq is faster, lighter on system resources, and has more features than Entrepot or Toniq. It is truly our best work as a team. Because of this, it makes sense to integrate ICP NFTs directly into Bioniq (choose your chain dropdown) so that we can continue to maintain a single fantastic cross-chain marketplace rather than trying to support multiple products.

Our long term goal is to make ICP NFT trading so fantastic on Bioniq that everyone chooses for themselves to trade there. And if Entrepot or Toniq aren't really used anymore, then yes, those would be phased out. But we're talking long term here, and only in the case that Entrepot/Toniq isn't helpful to anyone anymore.

content:
Bioniq is faster, lighter on system resources, and has more features than Entrepot or Toniq. It is truly our best work as a team. Because of this, it makes sense to integrate ICP NFTs directly into Bioniq (choose your chain dropdown) so that we can continue to maintain a single fantastic cross-chain marketplace rather than trying to support multiple products.

Our long term goal is to make ICP NFT trading so fantastic on Bioniq that everyone chooses for themselves to trade there. And if Entrepot or Toniq aren't really used anymore, then yes, those would be phased out. But we're talking long term here, and only in the case that Entrepot/Toniq isn't helpful to anyone anymore.

referenced_message.content:
We're not bridging to another place. We're not creating a new collection to go trade on an unfamiliar marketplace. We're not taking Motokos to OpenSea or MagicEden.

We're building a new home for NFTs on ICP in Bioniq. This Motoko collection will trade natively on Bioniq (on ICP). You could argue we're not even bridging them at all because Motoko Sentinels will trade directly on ICP (on Bioniq).

So this is completely different. 

We're even going to integrate ICP NFTs directly into Bioniq as well (we're like 80% done with this already) at which point Bioniq is a nice cross-chain marketplace. And then you can trade Motoko Ghosts/Mechs on the ICP side of Bioniq and you can trade Motoko Sentinels on the BTC side of Bioniq.

We've also already launched multiple collections on Bioniq, and have more in the pipeline, so this isn't a one-off collection. This is part of a cohesive strategy to help ICP grow by integrating with Bitcoin.

referenced_message.content:
One more quick thought here. Motoko Sentinels will be a **dynamic, gamified ordinal collection. **

You'll start with only a Motoko body. Then you send it on missions (staking it) for 1, 3, or 7 days to earn XP. XP will let you level up.

Level 1: Just Motoko body
Level 2: Adds background
Level 3: Adds front feature
Level 4: Adds tail

But there's a chance your Motoko will fail in the mission, at which point your Motoko will be damaged, and you'll have to pay 500 sats ($0.30) to repair it to send it on mission again.

If you let your Motoko sit too long it will rust, causing it to break. At which point you have to pay 500 sats to repair to send on missions again.

If your Motoko is rusting, you will slowly lose XP and move back down the levels (4 to 3 to 2 to 1, losing layers along the way).

The only way to prevent rusting is to get your Motoko to Level 4 and then inscribe it to Bitcoin.

This is the initial scope for the simple dynamic game associated with Motoko Sentinels.

referenced_message.content:
Here are a few of my guiding principles going into this collection:
1. I'm REALLY trying to bridge ICP and BTC communities with this collection.
2. I want real people to buy Motoko Sentinels. I don't want it heavily botted.
3. I want to reward people that deserve it.

To accomplish these three objectives, we decided to do an over-allocated WL. This ensures that many people from the WL will be able to buy and the collection won't get botted in a public sale. It also ensure we can price it more affordably in WL.

My only hesitation with giving Motoko holders a guaranteed WL allocation is I want this to FEEL like an ICP/BTC collection. And if I am giving too many benefits to Motoko Ghost holders, then it doesn't feel as much BTC.

We are WL'ing a number of BTC collections (many with a floor price that is 2-5x what Motokos are), with less favorable WL conditions (only 1 WL no matter how many you own).
